JavaScript Weekly

V8 v9.2 and the at Function â€” Every step forward the popular V8 JavaScript engine takes is news, but this is a relatively minor step with the biggest practical addition being the new 'at' method for Array, TypedArray and String. Oh, and Firefox 90 supports it too, plus a couple of other goodies.

Ingvar Stepanyan

The Road to Ember 4.0 â€” The Ember.js framework is ten years old this year and while itâ€™s not often in the headlines, itâ€™s one of the most solid, reliable and battle tested systems out there and a big update is on theÂ way.

What If Your Project Management Tool Was Fast and Intuitive? â€” Imagine how much more you could get done if your project management tools didn't make you sigh. Clubhouse is the ideal solution for task management, bug tracking, iteration planning, and reporting. Delight the scrum gods and give us aÂ try.

Clubhouse.io sponsor

HTM 3.1.0: A JSX Alternative using Standard Tagged Templates â€” This clever library has been around a few years but sees an update this week. Think JSX-style syntax but in plain JavaScript (using tagged templates) that requires no transpilation but still supports things like rest spread and referencingÂ components.

Jason Miller

Deno 1.12 Released â€” The â€˜server side JavaScript runtime that isnâ€™t Nodeâ€™ takes some more steps forward with TypeScript support in its REPL, improved Web Crypto support, and you can upgrade incoming HTTP requests on the (unstable) HTTP server to WebSocketÂ connections.

Casonato and IwaÅ„czuk

  • Hemanth HM shares updates from the latest TC39 meeting and the proposals discussed. He's also published â–¶ï¸ a new episode of the TC39er podcast interviewing Mozilla's Yulia Startsev about work on SpiderMonkey.

  • Want to perform a card trick with some JavaScript powered 'mind reading'? â–¶ï¸Â Computerphile has you covered.

  • Did you know you can get Postgres to return JSON directly?

  • Puppy is a neat minimal experimental Web browser written in Rust that supports JavaScript via V8.

  • It's not JavaScript at all but I was still blown away to learn about the almost 100 different types of DNS record that exist.

mem 9.0: Simple Memoization Library â€” Memoization is an optimization technique used to speed up consecutive function calls by caching the result of calls with identicalÂ arguments.

Sindre Sorhus

This package takes an interesting approach of creating its own root authority and issuing certificates automatically against it. Itâ€™s so slick though, I was impressed by it in myÂ tests.

LiveKit Team

items.content:
#â€‹546 â€” July 9, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The State of Web Workers in 2021 â€” The web is typically single-threaded, but two years ago Surma told us why to always use Web Workers to bring multithreading to your solutions despite the difficulties. Almost every client supports them now, so Surma makes the case again and explains why Web Workers deserve a place in yourÂ projects.

Surma

How export default thing is Different to export { thing as default } â€” When someone like Jake ends up having to chat to the V8 team to figure something out and then learns something, itâ€™s worth following along. Off down the export rabbit holeÂ weÂ go...

Jake Archibald

Uptime Monitoring Is Now Available in AppSignal â€” Uptime monitoring is the first line of defense against downtime. Ping your apps every minute from 4 locations around the world and receive alerts when something is down. Now you'll know about downtime before your usersÂ do.

AppSignal sponsor

npm audit: Broken by Design â€” â€œThe way npm audit works is broken. Its rollout as a default after every npm install was rushed, inconsiderate, and inadequate for the front-end tooling.â€ Dan adopts an untypically critical tone but does a good job of demonstrating how vulnerabilities are not all alike when it comes to whether they matter.

Dan Abramov

A Look at Building with Astro â€” Astro, which we featured a month ago, is a new framework for building sites where you get to use JavaScript frameworks but sites are rendered in staticÂ form.

Chris Coyier

Elementary: React-Inspired Functional, Declarative Audio Applications â€” Can writing audio DSP software be â€œsimple, fast and funâ€? Not up until now, but Elementary intends to change all that, and thus lowering the barriers to entry for this burgeoning field.

Nick Thompson

Quick Bits

  • How about a two-player self hosted Tic-tac-toe game in 640 bytes ofÂ JavaScript?
  • When I see someone flashing an ESP32 microcontroller from the browser, it reminds me just how far JavaScript and browsers haveÂ come.
  • Did you know you can run scripts (written in JavaScript) on a schedule on your Google Sheets spreadsheets? Here's a Twitter thread explaining how.

Releases

Highlight.js 11.1 â€” Web syntax highlighter library.
Gatsby 3.9 â€” React 'dynamic site generator.'
zx 2.0 â€” Better scripting with Node.js.
Snowpack 3.8 â€” Module driven frontend build tool.
ckeditor 29.0 â€” Rich text editor framework.
Rollup 2.53.0 â€” Next-generation ES module bundler.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

How to Use Promise.all() â€” Handle multiple promises at once, in parallel, and then get the result in a single aggregateÂ array.

Dmitri Pavlutin

Ultimate Guide to Building a UI Library: Building Robust Components â€” TJ VanToll shares what heâ€™s learned from over a decade of writing and working with UI components. Go to the blogÂ series.

Progress KendoReact sponsor

When a Click is Not Just a Click â€” There are nuances to consider when listening for a click event (such as a â€˜clickâ€™ sent from a keyboard versus one from a mouse). This post dives into how you can distinguish different types, and what opportunities arise from identifyingÂ them.

Travis Almand

â–¶Â Â Using Deno Deploy to Release Super Fast Cloud Functions â€” Jack promises a look into the â€œpotential JavaScript futureâ€ by building a chat app using Deno (a Node-a-like built by Nodeâ€™s original author, no less) and deploying it on the Deno Deploy platform. This is easy to understand and follow along with, and the approach taken feels so natural.

Jack Herrington

Breaking Down Bulky Builds with Netlify and Next.js â€” Using Next.jsâ€™ Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR) coupled with on-demand builders and Netlifyâ€™s Next on Netlify build plugins to create a site that builds certain routes only when needed, cutting the build time downÂ dramatically.

items.content:
#â€‹545 â€” July 2, 2021

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Temporal: Getting Started with JavaScriptâ€™s New Date andÂ TimeÂ API â€” JavaScriptâ€™s Date object and API is hard work at the best of times, but a lot of work has been done on Temporal, an all new approach currently at stage 3. Dr. Axel gives us a through, practical tour. Fantastic.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Solid 1.0: A Declarative JavaScript UI Library Worth Investigating â€” JavaScript isnâ€™t short of good reactive frameworks (React, Svelte, Vue..) but Solidâ€™s creator is determined and adamant to demonstrate how Solid addresses Reactâ€™s shortcomings while offering Svelte-like simplicity. He makes a good case, so try and give him at least a few minutes of yourÂ time.

Ryan Carniato

Download FusionAuth Today and Get a Free T-Shirt â€” FusionAuth is a modern CIAM that's fully customizable for your team. Implement complex standards like OAuth, SAML, and OpenID Connect. Build out additional features like SSO, MFA, and branded login pages. Plus, it's always free for unlimitedÂ users.

FusionAuth sponsor

ğŸ² Â The 'JS is Weird' Quiz â€” How well do you think you know the trickiest corners of JavaScript syntax and dynamic typing? Put yourself to the test with these 25 questions. Iâ€™m not even going to share my pathetic score.. ğŸ˜‚

Jacob Bergdahl

Quick Bits

JavaScript Weekly

ES2021 Now Approved; Here's the Features (Quickly) â€” Weâ€™ve linked to a short and sweet code-based summary of the big new features, but the actual news is that the Ecma General Assembly has approved ES2021. â–¶Â Â Coding Up a Mario Game in JavaScript with Kaboom.js â€” Ania is back showing us how to create a basic platformer in the course of an hour in her typically breezy, easy to followÂ manner. Watch this if you want to reignite that codingÂ spark.

Henrik and AndrÃ©

If you want a quick, handy JavaScript â€˜sandboxâ€™ on your desktop, itâ€™s worth checkingÂ out.

Quasar Framework

ApostropheCMS 3.0 Released â€” The latest release of a fully featured MIT-licensed Node.js-based CMS. Itâ€™s now powered by headless RESTful APIs from the ground up, has a new visual editing experience (powered by Vue.js), and improved modularity for extending it. GitHubÂ repo.

Alex Gilbert

Resemble.js 4.0: Image Analysis and Comparison Library â€” A Canvas-based approach for performing basic color/brightness analysis of images or to test how two images â€˜resembleâ€™ each other. Hereâ€™s a liveÂ demo.

Resemble

Software Brothers

Pica: Fast, High Quality Image Resizing in the Browser â€” For when you want to resize images yourself (from JavaScript code) and not lean on the browserâ€™s own engine. For example, for reducing images prior to upload. LiveÂ demo.

Nodeca

ip-address 8.0: Library for Parsing and Manipulating IP Addresses â€” Works with both IPv4 and IPv6Â addresses.

Beau Gunderson

Free Chat & Activity Feed APIs for Qualifying Teams

  • Stefan Judis looks at some lesser-known frontend auditing tools to help you acheive a faster website.
  • Here's a look at how you can get started with canvas animations in JavaScript â€” baby steps here, but well explained with examples.
  • Cristian Salcescu runs through ten utility functions to use when working with objects.
  • Here are some useful TypeScript patterns to "keep in your back pocket" when solving a difficult problem or two.

ğŸµÂ And one for fun..

iPod.js: A Web-Based JavaScript-Powered 'iPod' â€” Itâ€™s not just a fun UI experiment.. it can connect to Apple Music and Spotify to actually play tracks too. SourceÂ here. And yes, I'm listening to Linda Ronstadt.

Tanner Villarete
